metadata.Title: CVE-2016-5287 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A potentially exploitable use-after-free crash during actor destruction with service workers. This issue does not affect releases earlier than Firefox 49. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 49.0.2.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-5287` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 49.0.2+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
firefox-globalmenu - 49.0.2+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
firefox-mozsymbols - 49.0.2+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
firefox-testsuite - 49.0.2+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
No subscription required

notes.Note: sbeattie> firefox 49 contains commit that introduced issue

criterions.comment: firefox package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '49.0.2+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.2').
